intro: Dimeria agasthyamalayana, commonly known as the Agasthyamalai dimeria, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native region. It is often found in forested areas and is considered a rare species due to its limited distribution. The botanical features of Dimeria agasthyamalayana make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
